jobs.title: Senior FrontEnd Developer
jobs.description: Le posteDescriptif du posteğŸ“Location: Paris, FranceğŸ”What is Taster?Our vision is to revolutionise quick-service restaurants worldwide by crafting mouthwatering, iconic brands with top creators and then distributing them through next-generation franchise networks supercharged by Technology and innovation.Taster is at the forefront of the food delivery revolution in Europe, bringing the franchise model to the digital age with leading delivery-first brands, best-in-class technology, and an asset-light business model leveraging established delivery platforms and supply partners.This approach has successfully ensured that Taster can offer its customers quality food designed for delivery without compromise.The business has grown over 100% YoY on average over the last three years. With a unique, highly scalable business model and enviable unit economics (well above industry standards), Taster has reached over â‚¬100m in yearly GMV in January 2024 and is profitable. Operating within the global online food delivery market, which is expected to be worth $365 billion by 2030, and backed by Tier-1 investors, including Octopus Ventures, Local Globe, Heartcore Capital, Rakuten, and Battery Ventures.ğŸ§­ Why are we hiring?At Taster, weâ€™re on a mission to build the technology that powers the restaurants of tomorrow.To deliver on this vision, we design and build digital tools used by two key audiences:Customers: We aim to create a delightful ordering experience that makes our brands stand out and keeps people coming back.Restaurant Partners: We provide powerful, intuitive tools that streamline daily operations, drive profitability, and make running a kitchen easier and more enjoyable.As we scale, weâ€™re looking for a Senior Frontend Engineer to strengthen our frontend team. Youâ€™ll help build products that are critical to the success of our internal teams and external partners. If youâ€™re passionate about creating beautiful, efficient user interfaces and want to work in a fast-paced, product-driven environment â€” this role is for you.ğŸ¤ What will you do?Taster's proprietary tech stack powers our entire operation, from multi-platform order processing to our Click & Collect system, while transforming data into actionable insights. Our frontend suite includes a native Android app, an ordering app, and two backoffice solutions for operations and supply management. As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you will:Product & DeliveryOwn complex features end-to-end, from scoping to release and iteration.Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and backend engineers in an agile, impact-oriented team.Build intuitive, high-performance interfaces used by both customers and restaurant operators.Engineering ExcellenceContribute to the evolution of our frontend architecture and coding standards.Enrich our shared component library in partnership with the product design team.Champion performance, accessibility, and usability across the frontend.Write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code; regularly review code from peers.Mentorship & ImpactShare your knowledge with the team through code reviews, pair programming, and internal workshops.Help improve our testing and monitoring strategies to maintain high quality at scale.Take initiative on technical topics and advocate for improvements across the frontend stack.ğŸ› ï¸ Our stackReactReact-NativeExpoTypeScriptVitest & React Testing LibraryStorybookVue.js (legacy)Python + FastAPIGoogle Cloud and Sonarqube for CI/CD, Sentry for monitoringMore on our tools here: Taster StackshareWhy us?ğŸš€ We could tell you that you'll be able to join a foodtech profitable startup and that you'll be surrounded by a human size tech team of 14 people with a front end team of 3.ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» We could also tell you that if the Food sector interests you, this is just the unique opportunity to join an international team of foodtech experts.ğŸš† In short, we could tell you that you'll be able to work from home 2 days a week. But ...â­ ... What we really want to tell you is that our premises are great, located right in the heart of Paris, close to the best choice of restaurants and the best wax museum in the world.ğŸ¤ ...Mostly, we just want to tell you that this is your chance to sit almost every morning alongside a humble team who'll bend over backwards to make you feel good.ğŸŒ That the individuals who make up this team in London and Paris are all eager to grow from this experience together and to learn from each other.ğŸ’¼ That our way of working is driven by values that the employees have chosen themselves together: Quality, Innovation & Community.âœ… What are we looking for?Experience: At least 5 years of professional experience in frontend development, including at least 2 years with React Native.Autonomy & Initiative: Comfortable taking ownership of features and driving technical topics proactively.Collaboration: Proven experience working in cross-functional teams and communicating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Code Quality: Strong grasp of testing, performance, and modern frontend best practices.Curiosity & Growth Mindset: Passion for learning, sharing knowledge, and staying up-to-date with frontend trends.Experience with Storybook, custom component library and Vue is a plus.ğŸŒ Language requirementsYou are fluent in French and EnglishğŸ§ª Recruitment processInitial Interview (1h30) to find out more about you and your experience and to introduce you to the job and Taster with our head of HR and one of our tech leads.Technical review: 1-hour interview to assess your front skills with our front lead.Final Interview: A final 45-minute interview with our CTPO to assess your cultural fit.Voir plus

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
jobs.description: Le posteDescriptif du posteWeâ€™re creating a self-hosted SaaS platform designed for the most critical, regulated and air-gapped environments. As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you will design and deliver the operator-facing user experiences that make our Self-Hosted platform installable, observable, and operable by customers in highly constrained environments. Your mission is to build robust, offline-capable UIs that extend our SaaS DNA into self-hosted deployments.ğŸ“ The position is available in Rennes, Paris or fully remote in Europe.Your missions :Build a wizard-like installer/updater with preflight checks (CPU, memory, OS/K8s versions) that guides operators and fails gracefully on incompatibility.Develop UIs that let operators trigger diagnostics, capture logs/metrics/configs, and generate signed export bundlesEnsure all UIs are offline-capable (service workers, caching strategies).Provide clear remediation guidance and runbooks integrated into the UI.Design a UI for browsing, staging, and applying signed offline bundles (CTI, AI models, detection rules) with pin/rollback and compatibility checks.Ensure design and component consistency with our SaaS product, while adapting flows to on-prem constraints.Work closely with Backend Engineers and SREs to keep UX aligned with deployment architecture.Provide a lifecycle management UI for one-click upgrades, rollbacks, and version pinning.Voir plusProfil recherchÃ©ğŸ¤© We are excited to meet you if :You have a minimum of 5 yearsÂ professional experience in front-end development, with strong experience with Angular.You areÂ autonomous in your technological watchÂ and you are up-to-date with latest standardsYouÂ ensure code quality by following good development practicesÂ and strong test strategies. You are driven by simplicity & efficiency.YouÂ participate in code reviewsÂ and provide constructive feedback to team members.DÃ©roulement des entretiensğŸ“ Hereâ€™s whatâ€™s in store for you if you apply :HR Interview with ClÃ©mentine, Talent Acquisition Manager (30â€™)Use case to do at home (60â€™)Skills fit Interview with MickaÃ«l, Tech Lead, and a team member (60â€™)Final N+2 Interview with Georges, CTPO, and GaÃ«l, Head of Engineering (60â€™)Our process usually takes about 3 weeks, depending on availability. It includes reference calls.The program: discussions rather than trick questions ! These discussions will help you understand how Sekoia.io works and what it stands for. But they are also (and above all) an opportunity for you to tell us about your career path and your expectations for your next job!â­ Sekoia.io is an equal opportunity employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation. We are committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Software Engineer - AI Squad
jobs.description: Le posteDescriptif du postePitch â€” Why this role mattersHelp transform Spendesk into an AIâ€‘first spend management platform. As part of our new AI/Data squad, youâ€™ll ship magical user experiences powered by LLMs â€” from smart supplier recommendations to autonomous workflows that reduce manual work for customers. Youâ€™ll work endâ€‘toâ€‘end with ML engineers, PMs, and designers, using AWS Bedrock to integrate bestâ€‘inâ€‘class models and bring AI features to life in elegant, performant interfaces. This is a greenfield opportunity with real product impact and latitude to shape both UX and architecture.Role OverviewWe are looking for a talented Frontend Software Engineer to join our AI/Data squad and help shape the future of spend management with AI.As a Frontend Software Engineer, you will take ownership of both functional and technical topics. You will have the opportunity to work across the entire feature lifecycle, including specification, technical design, development, testing, documentation, and maintenance.Our stackTypeScriptNode.js for backend and banking applicationsReact on the frontendPostgreSQL for data storage; Redis, SQS, and Kafka for jobs and queuesTerraform to define our infrastructureKubernetes, Lambdas, and Step Functions to run our applicationsAWS as our cloud provider (including AWS Bedrock for LLM access)GitHub Actions for CIKey ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain AI systems and features, with a focus on intuitive, highâ€‘quality user experiences.Lead the design and development of performant, accessible, and userâ€‘friendly interfaces (React/TypeScript), including dataâ€‘rich flows and AIâ€‘assisted UIs.Collaborate closely with ML Engineers to integrate models (via AWS Bedrock), define guardrails, and design humanâ€‘inâ€‘theâ€‘loop interactions and feedback capture.Write clean, maintainable, and wellâ€‘tested code; contribute to our design system and frontend architecture.Instrument features with analytics, tracing, and evaluations to measure quality (latency, accuracy, UX outcomes) and drive iteration.Contribute to the technical vision and drive the implementation of complex projects; propose and ship POCs, run experiments/Aâ€‘B tests, and iterate quickly.Improve engineering processes, tools, and systems to enhance productivity and scalability.Mentor and inspire fellow engineers; share best practices in performance, accessibility, and testing.How we work (AI/Data squad)AIâ€‘first, productâ€‘led: we prototype fast, test with real users, and iterate based on signal.â€œYou build it, you run itâ€: squads own deployment, monitoring, and continuous improvements.Collaboration by default: work handâ€‘inâ€‘hand with PM, Design, ML Engineering, and (when needed) Sales/CS to understand problems and validate outcomes.Pragmatic engineering: we value clear tradeâ€‘offs, delivering impact over perfection.What weâ€™re looking forFluency in written and spoken English (our business language)2+ years of experience in software development (5+ years for Senior Engineer positions)Strong AI mindsetProven track record of delivering highâ€‘quality, scalable AI productsAbility to translate business and product concepts into technical solutionsEnthusiasm for working in a fastâ€‘paced environment, with a focus on continuous growth and craft masteryStrong customerâ€‘centric mindsetAlignment with Spendeskâ€™s core values of empowering businesses to achieve moreNiceâ€‘toâ€‘haves (not required)Experience building AIâ€‘assisted UIs (prompting patterns, humanâ€‘inâ€‘theâ€‘loop design, guardrails)Familiarity with AWS Bedrock or other LLM platforms; understanding of LLM evaluation and observabilityStrong frontend performance and accessibility expertise; profiling realâ€‘world React appsExperience with experimentation frameworks (A/B tests, feature flags) and analyticsWorking knowledge of Node.js services to collaborate effectively across the stackExample projects you might work onAccounting Assistant: Helps accountants collect receipts and context from end usersBudget Forecaster: Predicts budget needs based on historical data and business plansSpend Data Agent: Provides budget owners with insights on budget performance and trendsLocation and ways of workingWe value regular inâ€‘person collaboration. Weâ€™re primarily hiring in Paris or London (flexible hybrid). Outstanding remote candidates may be considered; this is not a remoteâ€‘first role.Hiring processHR Screening callDiscussion with a Hiring Manager (Head of Engineering)Technical interview: live coding (and/or technical design depending on seniority)Final interview with leadershipAs we are an international team, please submit your application and CV in English.About SpendeskSpendesk is the AI-powered spend management and procurement platform that transforms company spending. By simplifying procurement, payment cards, expense management, invoice processing, and accounting automation, Spendesk sets the new standard for spending at work. Its single, intelligent solution makes efficient spending easy for employees and gives finance leaders the full visibility and control they need across all company spend, even in multi-entity structures. Trusted by thousands of companies, Spendesk supports over 200,000 users across brands such as SoundCloud, Gousto, SumUp, and Bloom & Wild. With offices in the United Kingdom, France, Spain and Germany, Spendesk also puts community at the heart of its mission. For more information: www.spendesk.com/pressAbout our people & cultureWe believe that people do their best work when theyâ€™re given the freedom to thrive and grow. Thatâ€™s why liberation is at the core of everything we do. We empower Spendeskers to take ownership of their work, to navigate ambiguity, and seize every opportunity. Spendeskers come from all over the world (35+ countries and counting!) but we have plenty in common: we're bold, ever-curious, committed to kindness, and tackle every challenge with a positive mindset.About our benefitsOur culture is built on trust, empowerment, and growth â€” with benefits to match!Flexible on-site and remote policyLunch 60% funded by Spendesk (Swile Card)Alan Premium health insuranceA Gymlib pass to let off steam after a productive day at workAccess to Moka.care for emotional and mental health wellbeingAccess to Vendredi allowing us to change the worldLatest Apple equipmentGreat office snacks to fuel your dayA positive team to work with daily!Diversity & InclusionAt Spendesk, we're committed to fostering an environment where all differences are encouraged, supported and celebrated. We're building our culture for everyone, with everyone. Our goal is to attract and build a diverse, equal and inclusive team, where everyone feels welcome and we truly embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.What success looks like in your first 90 daysYouâ€™ve shipped your first AIâ€‘assisted UI in production and instrumented it with meaningful metrics.Youâ€™ve partnered with ML Engineers to refine prompts/guardrails and improved UX based on real usage data.Youâ€™ve contributed to our design system or frontend architecture with a performance or accessibility improvement.Youâ€™ve helped scope and deliver a POC or experiment that informed the roadmap.Voir plus
